name: deploy-aas-db
description: Deploy tabular databases to Azure Analysis Services or Power BI Premium
author: Jan Pieter Posthuma

inputs.name: connectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Service Connection to the Azure Analysis Services

inputs.name: connectedServiceNamePBI
inputs.label: Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the Service Connection to the Power BI tenant.

Install [Power Platform Build Tools](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=microsoft-IsvExpTools.PowerPlatform-BuildTools) for the service connection

inputs.name: aasServer
inputs.label: Analysis Services URL
inputs.helpMarkDown:
URL for either Azure Analysis Services or Power BI Premium Connection.

Example: 'asazure://westeurope.asazure.windows.net/fabrikam' or 'powerbi://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/fabrikam'

inputs.name: databaseName
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Tabular database

inputs.name: appId
inputs.label: Application ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Application ID of the Service Pricipal

inputs.name: appKey
inputs.label: Application Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Key for the Service Principal. It can accept variable defined in Build/Release Definitions as e.g. '$(spkey). You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it

inputs.name: adminName
inputs.label: Analysis Services Admin
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Analysis Services admin login

inputs.name: adminPassword
inputs.label: Analysis Services Admin Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the Analysis Services Admin. It can accept variable defined in Build/Release Definitions as e.g. '$(passwordVariable). You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it

inputs.name: pathToModel
inputs.label: Model file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the '.asdatabase'/'.bim' file

inputs.name: partitionDeployment
inputs.label: Partition Deployment
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Determine how existing partitions are treated during deployment.

- Deploy partitions: any existing partitions will be replaces
- Retain partitions: partitions of new tables will be deployed, but partitions for existing tables will be unaffected

inputs.name: roleDeployment
inputs.label: Role Deployment
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Determine how security roles and role members are treated during deployment.

- Deploy roles and members: any existing roles and members will be replaced
- Deploy roles and retain members: roles will be deployed along with their members for new roles. Members for existing roles will be retained
- Retain roles and members: the roles and members will not be deployed

inputs.name: connectionType
inputs.label: Data Source Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select how to connect the datasource(s) to their souces. Not applicable if target is Power BI Premium

inputs.name: sourceSQLServer
inputs.label: Source Azure SQL Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure SQL Server name, like fabrikam.database.windows.net,1433 or fabrikam.database.windows.net

inputs.name: sourceSQLDatabase
inputs.label: Source Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Azure SQL Database, where the files will be deployed

inputs.name: sourceSQLUsername
inputs.label: Source User Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Azure SQL Server user login

inputs.name: sourceSQLPassword
inputs.label: Source Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the Azure SQL Server user. It can accept variable defined in Build/Release Definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'. You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it

inputs.name: datasources
inputs.label: Advanced datasource security settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: JSON structure with datasource 'connectionDetails' and 'credentials'

inputs.name: ipDetectionMethod
inputs.label: Specify Firewall Rules Using
inputs.helpMarkDown:
For successful execution of the task, we need to enable administrators to access the Azure Analysis Services from the IP Address of the automation agent.
By selecting auto-detect you can automatically add firewall exception for range of possible IP Address of automation agent ​or else you can specify the range explicitly

inputs.name: startIpAddress
inputs.label: Start IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The starting IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.50

inputs.name: endIpAddress
inputs.label: End IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ending IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.65

inputs.name: deleteFirewallRule
inputs.label: Delete Rule After Task Ends
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, the added exception for IP addresses of the automation agent will be removed for corresponding Azure Analysis Services

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: [DEPRECATED] Not used anymore

inputs.name: remove
inputs.label: Remove before Deploy
inputs.helpMarkDown: [DEPRECATED] Not used anymore

inputs.name: targetAzurePs
inputs.label: Azure PowerShell Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: [DEPRECATED] Not used anymore. Task is running with Windows PowerShell 5.1

inputs.name: customTargetAzurePs
inputs.label: Preferred Azure PowerShell Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: [DEPRECATED] Not used anymore. Task is running with Windows PowerShell 5.1
